content.description: Climbs the thin, slightly off-vertical face using the anchors on Bat Wings and Blood.
content.location:
Just right of

Bat Wings and Blood

.

climbs.name: Witches' Brew
climbs.fa: Steve Kravchuck, Brad Singer & Dave Lepere, September 2000

content.description:
Fun climbing on in-cut patina plates with a few difficult moves thrown in down low make for an enjoyable outing.

The anchor for this is in a horrible spot, so better to use the anchors for the climb to the right.
content.location:
Scramble up a slab right of

Bat Wings And Blood

to reach the start of this route, which starts from a large ledge system.

content.description: This climbs an attractive face behind a tree well left of the other routes on the wall. Bolts may be chopped at this time.
content.location:
Around and left about 50 feet from

Voodoo Highway

, facing west.

climbs.name: Voodoo Jive
climbs.fa: Chris Miller and Pete Paredes, September 2000

content.description: This entirely independent line climbs a slab and then pulls the right side of the prominent roof to delicate face climbing along an arete and the anchors.
content.protection:
TR from anchors atop

Goblin Roof
content.location:
Located just to the right of

Goblin Roof

.

content.description: Climb the featured face past edges, side-pulls to a thinner section (crux) just before the last bolt. Bolted anchor, with an easy down-climb about 20 feet to the left.
content.location:
This short route climbs the right side of a large block just left of

The Sceptre

.

climbs.name: Snape
climbs.fa: Pete Paredes and Chris Miller, August 2004

content.description:
Scramble up a slab right of

Bat Wings And Blood

to reach the start of this route, which starts from a large ledge system.

Fun climbing up a featured face with a low crux.
content.location:
Just right of

Witches' Brew

and left of a wide crack.

content.description: This is a fun climb with lots of smearing and bear-hugging up the narrow rib. Shorter climbers may find this slightly more challenging.
content.location: Second route from the left and up the narrow pillar formed by two wide cracks.

content.description: Climbs interesting face to finish in a crack; Use anchors on one of the adjacent routes.

climbs.name: Malfoy
climbs.fa: Chris Miller, Bryan Dennison & Soo Dennison, August 2004

content.description:
Scramble up a slab right of

Bat Wings And Blood

to reach the start of this route, which starts from a large ledge system.

A low crux leads to fun featured face climbing; a little slice of Holcomb without the crowds.
content.location:
The next bolted route right of

Harry's Crack

.

content.description: An entertaining chimney that splits the face in the center of the wall.
content.location:
The wide crack right of

Bat Wings and Blood

.

climbs.name: Harry's Crack
climbs.fa: Dave LePere and Brad Singer, September 2000

content.description:
Scramble up a slab right of

Bat Wings And Blood

to reach the start of this route, which starts from a large ledge system.

Thrash up the wide crack which features a low crux.
content.protection: Gear to 4 inches, anchors (shared with Snape)
content.location:
The wide crack immediately right of

Snape

.

climbs.name: Goblin Roof
climbs.fa: Pete Paredes, Brad Singer, Steve Kravchuck, Dave Lepere & Chris Miller, September 2000

content.description:
Boulder up to the base where you'll find a large, flat ledge. Tricky slab moves (crux) past the first bolt gain a small roof, and another bolt, which is pulled on jugs. Higher, balancy and fun moves on featured rock lead to anchors.

Starting off a boulder from the left avoids the slab crux and makes it 5.8.
content.location: Located on the far right side of the Voodoo Wall facing east, this climbs a slab to roof that's clearly visible on the approach.

content.description:
This is the wide crack that defines the left side of the pillar with

The Sceptre

.
content.location:
Obvious wide crack between

Voodoo Highway

and

The Sceptre

.

content.description: Worm your way up this wide crack/chimney system.
content.location:
The obvious wide crack just right of a slender pillar -

The Sceptre

.

content.description: Fun climbing on good rock with the crux being some patina edges with smallish feet. It's best to use the anchors on the route to the left (The Sceptre) unless you feel like thrashing your rope.
